item.title: Street pavement tree completely overgrown, 8th September
item.description:

item.title: Slimy leaf litter in gutter at zebra crossing, 7th September
item.description:
Some 2 weeks ago one of the 2 water meters was leaking outside 30 & 30A Elm Road. The fallen leaves have now formed a slimy mess on the pavement outside and an ever greater slimy mess in the gutter over the zebra crossing outside 24 Elm Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Elm Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is outside 127 Amhurst Road, 7th September
item.description:
The overflowing bins on the green seems to result in more people fly tipping in this area. Please could the overflowing bins be discussed with the local businesses, they want a solution too (I have asked them!). Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling thrown on the floor, 7th September
item.description:
Witnessed a man remove recycled goods and throw unwanted items on the curb

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A flag has been attached to public lamppost, 7th September
item.description:
The flag has appeared Saturday overnight. It’s too high for us to take down. Particularly concerned in current political climate that it is antagonistic especially with a number of different nationalities living opposite and nearby. Are you able to help please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollingworth Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: By the tree outside 106 Victoria Road, 7th September
item.description:
Not sure how your team can miss it. Still there. Black bag with heavy rubbish. Unless Brent teams needs new eye prescriptions. This has already been reported previously and the team can’t see the bag?!?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 hours after the area being cleared, more bags dumped, 7th September
item.description:
The clothing bin is (as usual) full so bags have been dumped on the street . Very unfortunate as a clear up was done this morning and by early afternoon, more was dumped . Seems this location attracts this despite the negative impact on local residents

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webber Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faded street name plate, 7th September
item.description:
Pickford Road name plate/sign, on the side nearest the Broadway end, is faded to the extent that it is not able to identify the name of the road for pedestrians and car drivers. Please would you consider replacing? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
